newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico Bondes rate barely changed at auction.
newsitem.headline: Mexico Bondes rate barely changed at auction.

text.p: The rate on Mexican government 728-day development bonds, or Bondes, rose 0.01 percentage point to 1.26 percent above the one-month Cetes rate in Tuesday's primary auction, dealers estimated.
The two-year Bondes were assigned at 97.93193 pesos.
Demand for the Bondes was 2.58 billion pesos compared to the 900 million pesos offered by the Banco de Mexico.

Last week, the two-year Bondes fell 0.17 percentage points to 1.25 percent above the one-month Cetes rate and were assigned at 97.95565 pesos on 4.44 billion pesos worth of demand compared to the 700 million pesos offered by Banco de Mexico.
